name: Green Goddess Dressing
description: Green Goddess is a California classic. It makes a great dip for crudités and a wonderful dressing for robust lettuces like romaine hearts, but it’s too thick and intense for delicate spring mixes. Although I’ve made the anchovies optional, I recommend them because they add depth to the flavor. If salt is an issue for you, leave them out.
recipeYield: Makes a little more than 1 1/2 cups
recipeIngredient: 1 cup packed watercress or spinach leaves, stemmed
1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon Champagne vinegar or sherry vinegar
1/2 cup canola oil or grapeseed oil

recipeInstructions.text: In a blender, combine the parsley, watercress or spinach, tarragon, chives, garlic, anchovies, lemon juice, vinegar and canola or grapeseed oil. Blend until smooth, about two minutes. Add the mayonnaise, and blend again until smooth. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
